title: Convex mirror set - image type when object is at P

content.description: An object is placed in front of a convex mirror, as shown in the figure. The object is initially located at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mtext>P</mtext></math>. A second point, Point <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mtext>Q</mtext></math>, is twice as far from the mirror as Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mtext>P</mtext></math>.
content.question: Is the image formed by the mirror real or virtual when the object is at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>P</mtext></math>? What evidence or reasoning helps support the claim?

choices.label: Real. The image is inverted relative to the objectâ€™s original orientation.
Real. The rays from the object and the rays forming the image are all on the same side of the mirror.
Virtual. There is only one focal point for the mirror.
Virtual. Light rays from a point on the object diverge after reflection.

content.answer: Virtual. Light rays from a point on the object diverge after reflection.
